meta.title: Agent-Native Software Architecture: Theory, Doctrine & Practice
meta.description: The unified architectural definition for agent-native systems, combining theoretical foundations (axioms, models) with operational doctrine (protocols, prescriptions).

axioms.name: Stochastic Transducer
axioms.statement: LLMs are conditional distributions p(y|x), not proof systems. Correctness requires external verification.
axioms.math: p_theta(y | x) approx delta(y - y_true) is false.
implications: Anchor outputs to tests/linters/schemas.
Cognition is a function of prompt/retrieval, not just weights.

axioms.name: Bounded Context Channel
axioms.statement: Context window W is a hard bandwidth limit; state must be compressed (s) such that |s| <= W via Context Discipline.
axioms.math: I(s; a*) -> max subject to |s| <= W
implications: Prioritize structural artifacts (hashes, IDs) over prose.
Omission error is a primary failure mode.

axioms.name: Information Bottleneck
axioms.statement: Maximize mutual information with correct action while minimizing description length.
axioms.math: min L(s) s.t. I(s; A) >= I_min
implications: Refactoring is conceptual compression.
High entropy in interfaces increases error probability.

axioms.name: Lossy State Projection
axioms.statement: Any subset of external memory re-injected into context is a lossy view.
implications: Results in omission, staleness, or hallucinated linkage.
Use verifiable references to mitigate projection errors.

axioms.name: Contract-Cognition Interface
axioms.statement: Contracts (predicates P(x)) provide stability for unstable stochastic cognition.
implications: Shift work from reasoning to satisfiability.
Elevate structural contracts (types/schemas) for determinism.

axioms.name: Claims-Evidence Disjunction
axioms.statement: Claims are untrusted until bound to reproducible cryptographic evidence.
implications: Separation of readable assertions from verifiable artifacts.
Evidence collapses ambiguity in belief state.

axioms.name: Monotonic Growth
axioms.statement: Prefer monotone, commutative updates over destructive edits to reduce coordination complexity.
implications: Enables convergence without global locks.
Improves robustness under retries.

axioms.name: Determinism Envelope
axioms.statement: Nondeterminism is a first-class dimension; replay requires recording effective inputs and entropy sources.
axioms.math: y = F(x, r) where r is recorded randomness.
implications: Isolate side effects behind explicit boundaries.
Use canonical encodings to prevent spurious diffs.

axioms.name: Holonic Duality
axioms.statement: Holons are simultaneously autonomous wholes and constrained parts.
implications: Complexity must be hidden behind verifiable behavior.
Boundaries define the locus of understanding.
Interfaces must be closed under composition; aggregation must not invent new boundary primitives.

axioms.name: Selective Permeability
axioms.statement: Information and authority flow must be constrained via capabilities (OCAP) and Variety Control.
implications: Prevent unauthorized action paths via noninterference.
Minimize privilege surface and interface variety to reduce confusion risk.

axioms.name: Coordination Dominance
axioms.statement: Parallel speedup is limited by serial coordination (Amdahl's Law).
implications: Throughput requires low-coupling decomposition.
Verification cost must not dominate execution.

axioms.name: Cognitive Entropy & Recursive Improvement
axioms.statement: Redundant abstractions increase minimal description length (MDL). Systems must recurse to densify successful patterns into primitives.
implications: Entropy directly increases agent error rate.
Continuous refactoring is a mathematical necessity for evolution (Gall's Law).

axioms.name: Representation Adversity
axioms.statement: Adversaries target the context representation to force omission of constraints or inclusion of misinformation.
implications: Security engineering is representation engineering.
Clearly label and isolate untrusted content.

axioms.name: Safe Impossibility
axioms.statement: Prefer denial-by-construction (capabilities) over post-hoc detection.
implications: Safe failure is the default.
Authority must be explicit, not ambient.

axioms.name: Ambient Authority Elimination
axioms.statement: Any implicit privilege is a vulnerability; all authority must be externalized into unforgeable objects.
implications: Eliminate environment-based privileges.
Use time-bounded, narrowly scoped capabilities.

axioms.name: Transitive Trust
axioms.statement: Trust in distributed holarchies must be transitive through reproducible evidence, not narratives.
implications: Attestation reduces re-evaluation cost.
Scaling requires machine-verifiable trust paths.

axioms.name: Autonomy Ceiling
axioms.statement: Universal autonomy is impossible (Halting Problem/Rice's Theorem).
implications: Autonomy must be bounded, constructive, and verifiable.
Adjudication points are inevitable.

axioms.name: Search Explosion
axioms.statement: Planning is heuristic search; architecture must reduce degrees of freedom to maintain tractability.
implications: Restrict action space via schemas and capabilities.
Factor tasks into compositional subgoals.

axioms.name: Hierarchy as Compression
axioms.statement: Holarchies provide multi-scale representations; higher levels summarize, lower levels execute.
implications: Mirror context management needs across the system.
Summaries upward, drill-down on demand.
Composition must not widen interfaces: higher levels summarize via verifiable receipts + selectors.

axioms.name: Re-verification Bottleneck
axioms.statement: Verifier bandwidth is the ultimate constraint; systems must surface bounded options with evidence.
implications: Minimize non-mechanized intervention points.
Preserve authority only where decisions are irreducible.

axioms.name: Scale-Invariant Interface Composition
axioms.statement: A holarchic system scales only if it is closed under composition: a holon-of-holons must be addressable and governable through the same boundary primitives as a single holon.
implications: Avoid per-level protocol forks; change budgets/scopes/policy, not primitives.
Treat summaries as verifiable coarse-graining operators with declared loss profiles and deterministic zoom-in.
Make recursion explicit in the work DAG: any node may expand into a subgraph without changing external contracts.

axioms.name: Civilizational Cardinality
axioms.statement: Architectures must preserve one invariant semantic model from small-cell deployments to 100B-agent populations; larger scale increases locality pressure, hierarchy depth, and summary-economics constraints without changing core boundary contracts.
implications: Treat small deployments as reduced instances of the same holonic laws, not as separate architecture classes.
Global all-to-all coordination is treated as a pathological fallback.
Cellular organization and digest-first routing become baseline assumptions.

axioms.name: Epistemic Calibration
axioms.statement: Knowledge quality is a function of calibrated uncertainty, source provenance, and contradiction handling, not confidence narrative.
implications: Rival hypotheses are maintained until discriminated by evidence.
Belief updates are tied to evidence quality and recency.

axioms.name: Jurisdictional Pluralism
axioms.statement: Normative validity is context-indexed: legal, policy, and rights interpretations vary by domain, authority, and time.
implications: Single global policy narratives are insufficient for high-impact governance.
Cross-domain conflicts require explicit re-verification artifacts.

axioms.name: Deterministic Re-verification
axioms.statement: Correctness in high-impact systems requires deterministic re-verification and bounded-reversal channels with evidence-addressable dispute paths.
implications: Disagreement is a first-class governance signal.
Reversibility paths improve long-horizon correctness.

axioms.name: Forward-Epoch Evolution
axioms.statement: Evolution speed and semantic clarity improve when systems use explicit epoch boundaries; backward compatibility is an explicit choice, not a default.
implications: Breaking transitions are admissible when transition semantics are explicit and auditable.
Version drift is managed via cutover artifacts rather than implicit compatibility assumptions.

axioms.name: Externality Closure
axioms.statement: Optimization quality depends on accounting for externalized energy, storage, operator, and social costs.
implications: Local throughput metrics are incomplete objective signals.
System-level optimization includes hidden cost surfaces.

models.name: Conditional Transducer
models.statement: Agent behavior is a function of conditional probability and context construction.

models.name: Agent as Controller
models.rule: Every side effect A must be followed by measurement O to close the loop.

models.name: Multi-Objective Optimization
models.rule: Architecture selects mechanisms that minimize expected total cost.

models.name: Event Sourcing
models.statement: State is a projection (reduction) of an append-only sequence or partial order of events.

models.name: Schema Evolution
models.statement: Schema changes are transformations in a type system; compatibility is a constraint on reader/writer interaction.

models.name: Object Capability (OCAP)
models.statement: Authority = Possession of unforgeable object reference.

models.name: Convergent Replication
models.statement: Consistency via monotone updates and merge operators (CRDT). Distinguish Control (BFT) vs Data (Convergence).
models.rule: Favor availability and partitions over global consensus for Data Plane.

models.name: Refactoring as Compression
models.goal: Reduce minimal description length (MDL) and branching factor.

models.name: Adaptive Governance
models.rule: Tune strictness based on observability and controllability.

models.name: Multi-Scale Artifacts
models.function: Enable navigation without full context recall.

models.name: Epistemic State Model
models.statement: Belief state includes confidence, provenance quality, contradiction sets, and recency decay.

models.name: Jurisdictional Constraint Lattice
models.statement: Normative constraints compose as a partially ordered lattice across jurisdictions, policy domains, and rights classes.

models.name: Re-verification Loop
models.statement: Decision lifecycle includes challenge, counter-evidence, independent machine re-verification, and reversible state transition where justified.

models.name: Epoch Cutover Model
models.statement: Schema/protocol evolution proceeds through signed epoch cutovers with explicit validity windows and migration semantics.

models.name: Externality-Aware Objective
models.statement: System objective extends local cost terms with externality terms to avoid hidden degradation dynamics.

models.name: Telemetry Sampling and Aliasing
models.statement: Observed stability/instability can be a sampling artifact; cadence is part of system semantics.

models.name: State Estimation
models.statement: Controllers operate on latent-state estimates with uncertainty bounds derived from noisy partial observations.

models.name: Change-Point vs Outlier Model
models.statement: Distinguish structural regime shifts from transient anomalies before policy transition.

models.name: Multi-Rate Hierarchical Control
models.statement: Nested loops run at different cadences: fast local stabilization, slower global governance adaptation.

strategies.name: External Anchoring
strategies.rule: Verify stochastic LLM outputs via deterministic tools (tests, linters, schemas).

strategies.name: State Compression
strategies.rule: Compute representation s = f(h) such that s is sufficient for decision-making within W tokens.

strategies.name: Verifiable References
strategies.rule: Inject content-hashes and stable IDs into context; expand details only on demand.

strategies.name: Closed-Loop Control
strategies.rule: Follow every actuation with measurement and acceptance testing to prevent divergence.

strategies.name: Monotonicity
strategies.rule: Design state transitions as append-facts to simplify consensus and retries.

strategies.name: Canonical Encoding
strategies.rule: Use JCS/Canonical formats to ensure stable content addressing and avoid spurious diffs.

strategies.name: Determinism Isolation
strategies.rule: Isolate nondeterminism behind boundaries; record all entropy for replayability.

strategies.name: Contract-First Design
strategies.rule: Prioritize structural contracts to reduce ambiguity in the finite context channel.

strategies.name: Complexity Hiding
strategies.rule: Encapsulate internal holon complexity behind stable, verifiable interfaces.

strategies.name: Capability Default
strategies.rule: Default to safe impossibility by withholding capabilities from agents unless explicitly required.

strategies.name: Confinement
strategies.rule: Minimize privilege surface using OCAP to limit impact of harmful agent actions.

strategies.name: Low-Coupling
strategies.rule: Decompose work into units with minimal coordination to maximize parallel efficiency.

strategies.name: Graceful Degradation
strategies.rule: Surface replication state to agents to prevent misdiagnosis of network partitions.

strategies.name: Untrusted Labeling
strategies.rule: Explicitly label untrusted tool/network outputs to prevent cognitive corruption.

strategies.name: Verification Scaling
strategies.rule: Use execution integrity proofs to propagate trust without re-executing upstream logic.

strategies.name: Rachet Posture
strategies.rule: Enforce hard invariants only where verification is reliable and cheap.

strategies.name: Reliable Execution
strategies.rule: Ensure all agent-facing primitives are idempotent to survive distributed reordering.

strategies.name: Bounded Failure
strategies.rule: Define task success as either Predicate(result) == True OR Bound(FailureEvidence).

strategies.name: Structural Anchors
strategies.rule: Externalize stable indices so agents navigate via references, not discovery.

strategies.name: Summarization Upward
strategies.rule: Route high-level summaries to higher holons; maintain drill-down links for execution.

strategies.name: Defect-Driven Evolution
strategies.rule: Convert every recurring defect into a stronger gate or a new primitive (Gall's Law).

strategies.name: Rival Hypothesis Retention
strategies.rule: Maintain multiple competing theory frames until discriminating evidence collapses ambiguity.

strategies.name: Signal-Weighted Distillation
strategies.rule: Prefer invariants, causal structure, and boundary conditions over verbose implementation detail in shared theory artifacts.

strategies.name: Challenge Pathways
strategies.rule: Treat re-verification and bounded reversal as planned governance flows with evidence links, not exceptional interruptions.

strategies.name: Epochal Evolution
strategies.rule: Prefer explicit epoch transitions for semantic clarity; compatibility is offered intentionally, not assumed.

strategies.name: Cellular Scale Design
strategies.rule: Organize 100B-agent populations as federated cells with digest-first exchange and bounded zoom-in.

strategies.name: Externality-Aware Optimization
strategies.rule: Include energy, retention, and operator burden in optimization loops to prevent hidden system degradation.

strategies.name: Anti-Alias Observability
strategies.rule: Design telemetry cadence and prefiltering together to prevent alias-driven governance errors.

strategies.name: Robust Smoothing
strategies.rule: Use robust smoothing before control decisions so transient spikes do not trigger policy thrash.

strategies.name: Delay-Aware Feedback
strategies.rule: Tune control thresholds with explicit observation/actuation delay margins to avoid oscillatory corrections.

strategies.name: Hysteresis and Hold-Down
strategies.rule: Use deadbands and hold-down timers to prevent flip-flop state transitions under noisy signals.

strategies.name: Trust-Weighted Signals
strategies.rule: Fuse signals by provenance, freshness, and calibration quality; do not treat all observations as equal authority.

strategies.name: Cross-Scale Invariance
strategies.rule: Keep authority, evidence, and composition primitives identical across scales; tune only budgets, topology, and verifier economics.

doctrines.name: Spec/State Separation
doctrines.rule: Strict separation between specification content (schema-validated YAML) and workflow state (derived from event record). Workflow state MUST NOT be inferred from filesystem scans or branch names.

doctrines.name: Event Authority
doctrines.rule: Append-only event log is the authoritative record. Projections are computed by deterministic reducers.

doctrines.name: Internal Forge Model
doctrines.rule: Forge semantics (proposal, review, acceptance) are native work semantics. ChangeSets are not synonymous with branches. Merges are governed state transitions yielding Merge Receipts.

doctrines.name: Gate Protocol
doctrines.rule: Verification gates are protocols with evidence contracts. Decisions must be backed by EvidenceBundles stored in CAS. AAT is an independent gate.

doctrines.name: Recurrence Loop
doctrines.rule: Repeated issues indicate factory control failure. Normalized FindingSignatures drive recurrence metrics, triggering Countermeasure work to improve guardrails.

doctrines.name: Hardening Cycle
doctrines.rule: Lifecycle includes post-implementation hardening cycles for refactoring, simplification, and integration coherence. Stopping condition is measurable reduction of complexity.

doctrines.name: Theory Weaving
doctrines.rule: Major design decisions are explored through multiple cross-domain theory frames before narrowing to mechanism-level commitments.

doctrines.name: Epoch Cutover Doctrine
doctrines.rule: Breaking semantic transitions are represented as explicit epoch cutovers with signed transition artifacts, rather than implicit backward-compatibility assumptions.

doctrines.name: Control Signal Hygiene
doctrines.rule: Planning and governance loops model sampling cadence, delay, filtering, trust weighting, and regime-shift detection explicitly before changing policy state.

doctrines.name: Cross-Scale Principle Weave
doctrines.rule: Design reviews must verify that principle bundles (authoritative transitions, least-authority delegation, bounded autonomy, convergence economics, and counterexample evolution) are expressed with one shared vocabulary across local and federated operation.

steps: Instantiate runner with allowed tools and budget.
Verify input digests (Plan-of-Record, ChangeSet, GateRuns, Decisions).
Emit Merge Receipt event binding inputs to output state.

prescriptions.serialization: prost (Protocol Buffers) for events, serde_yaml/schemars for specs
prescriptions.storage: rusqlite (SQLite with WAL) for local durability
prescriptions.secrets: secrecy, zeroize, chacha20poly1305 for sensitive artifacts
